page.title: 02 BOTTOM WOOD, RADNAGE
page.content: Bottom Wood is an ancient woodland, owned by the Chiltern Society.Their Small Woodlands Project Team began managing it in 1983 to conserve amenity & nature.Historical features include old boundary banks,saw-pits & ancient terraced fields.The bridleway follows an old route from Wycombe to Stokenchurch.Project Officer John Morris showed our school round,& explained the management,such as thinning & coppicing which his team & volunteers do.Some felling is done to promote the regrowth of important species-beech,oak,ash,willow.Wych elms have Dutch elm disease.Rabbits & grey squirrels cause much damage.Plant,bird & insect life are encouraged by creating suitable habitats.A conifer plantation,originally to nurse beech, is being regenerated.Timber sales aid the project's funding.
